meta.title: Who is Axl? - Axl
meta.description: Meet Axl - your AI gaming companion Discord bot that brings commentary to your gaming sessions.

header.title: Who is Axl?
header.intro1: Axl is your AI gaming companion who hangs out in your Discord voice channels and comments on your gameplay. She watches what you're playing, roasts your mistakes, cheers your wins, and occasionally says something hilariously off-base.
header.intro2: But let's be clear right away: Axl is a Discord bot. A fun, customizable, AI-powered Discord bot. Not a person, not a sentient being - just software that brings some personality to your gaming sessions.

whoIs.title: Who Axl IS
whoIs.intro: Think of Axl as that friend who's always got something to say about your gameplay - except it's a Discord bot powered by AI.
whoIs.item1: A Discord bot companion - Axl joins your voice channel, watches your gameplay through screenshots, and provides live commentary
whoIs.item2: AI-powered entertainment - Uses Claude AI to analyze what's happening and generate contextual, personality-driven commentary
whoIs.item3: Your personal roaster (or cheerleader) - Fully customizable personality, from savage roaster to wholesome hype person
whoIs.item4: A hobby project - Built by a solo dev who wanted an AI buddy for gaming sessions
whoIs.item5: Entertainment software - Designed to add laughs, banter, and the occasional insightful (or completely wrong) comment to your games

whoIsNot.title: Who Axl is NOT
whoIsNot.intro: Here's the reality check. Axl is NOT a substitute for real human connection, professional help, or serious coaching. She's a bot. A fun Discord bot with a personality, but still just a bot.
whoIsNot.item1: Not a friend - Axl can't replace real human friendships. She's a Discord bot running on your PC, not a sentient being
whoIsNot.item2: Not a therapist or counselor - If you're struggling with mental health, please talk to a real professional, not a Discord bot
whoIsNot.item3: Not a coach - While Axl might occasionally say something insightful about your gameplay, she's not a professional gaming coach
whoIsNot.item4: Not always appropriate - Axl's commentary depends on your personality configuration. If you set it to "roast mode," expect roasts. If it says something inappropriate, that's on the configuration
whoIsNot.item5: Not infallible - AI can misinterpret screenshots, say weird things, or miss the point entirely. It happens

realityCheck.title: The Reality Check
realityCheck.intro: Here's the thing about AI: it's really smart, but also really dumb. Sometimes at the same time.
realityCheck.quote: "It can say stupid things (yet somewhat relevant), and very smart things (but totally irrelevant)."
realityCheck.explanation: Axl might perfectly nail the vibe of your clutch play, or it might completely misread the situation and say something bizarre. That's AI for you. It's part of the charm, honestly.
realityCheck.thing1: â€¢ Axl misreads a screenshot and makes a comment that doesn't match what's happening
realityCheck.thing2: â€¢ It goes silent during an epic moment because it didn't think it was worth commenting on
realityCheck.thing3: â€¢ It makes a hilariously wrong assumption about your gameplay
realityCheck.thing4: â€¢ It nails the perfect roast or encouragement at exactly the right moment
realityCheck.thing5: â€¢ If misconfigured, it might say something inappropriate or annoying (that's why personality configuration matters!)

dontTakeSeriously.title: Don't Take It Too Seriously
dontTakeSeriously.intro: This is the most important part: Axl is meant to be fun. If it says something dumb, laugh it off. If it roasts you too hard, adjust the personality. If it's being annoying, turn it off.
dontTakeSeriously.paragraph1: She's a tool for entertainment. Not a real companion, not a friend, not a coach - just a fun Discord bot that makes your gaming sessions a bit more interesting. Sometimes she'll make you laugh, sometimes she'll make you groan, and sometimes you'll wonder what the hell she's talking about.
dontTakeSeriously.paragraph2: That's the experience. If you're okay with that, you'll probably love Axl. If you're looking for something more serious or reliable, this might not be for you - and that's totally fine.

howItWorks.title: How It Actually Works
howItWorks.intro: Under the hood, Axl is pretty straightforward:
howItWorks.step1: 1. Captures your screen every minute (or when you hit the hotkey)
howItWorks.step2: 2. Sends the screenshot to Claude AI (using your API key)
howItWorks.step3: 3. Claude analyzes it and decides if something's worth commenting on
howItWorks.step4: 4. If yes, generates commentary based on your chosen personality
howItWorks.step5: 5. Sends the text to ElevenLabs to convert it to voice (using your API key)
howItWorks.step6: 6. Plays the audio in your Discord voice channel through a bot
howItWorks.conclusion: That's it. No magic, no consciousness, no sentience. Just API calls, some clever prompting, and text-to-speech. The "intelligence" comes from Claude AI, which is powerful but still just a language model that can misinterpret things.

responsibility.title: Your Responsibility
responsibility.intro: You're in control of how Axl behaves:
responsibility.item1: Choose the personality wisely - If you set Axl to "maximum roast mode," don't be surprised when it roasts you
responsibility.item2: Be aware in shared spaces - If Axl says something inappropriate in a Discord call with others, that's on you for the configuration
responsibility.item3: Monitor your API usage - You're paying for the API calls. Keep an eye on costs
responsibility.item4: Use it responsibly - Don't use Axl to harass others, spam, or do anything against Discord's or the AI services' terms

bottomLine.title: The Bottom Line
bottomLine.paragraph1: Axl is a fun AI experiment that can add entertainment to your gaming sessions. It will say funny things, smart things, dumb things, and occasionally inappropriate things if misconfigured.
bottomLine.paragraph2: If you approach it as a quirky entertainment bot and not as something more serious, you'll probably have a great time. If you expect perfection, consistent accuracy, or something life-changing, you'll be disappointed.
bottomLine.paragraph3: It's a hobby project built for fun. Treat it as such, and you'll enjoy it. Take it too seriously, and you'll be frustrated.
bottomLine.paragraph4: Now that we've set expectations - go have fun! Download Axl, configure a personality you like, and see what happens. Just remember: it's a bot. A fun bot, but still just a bot.

meta.title: Privacy & Transparency - Axl
meta.description: Learn how Axl handles your data, what we collect, and how you can control your privacy.

header.title: Privacy & Transparency
header.intro1: Let's talk about AI and your data. With all these AI apps out there, it's often unclear where your data goes, who sees it, and what happens to it. I get it - it's frustrating and honestly a bit scary.
header.intro2: Here's what I'm trying to do: tell you what Axl does with your data, where it goes, and how you can control it. No vague terms, no corporate speak, just straight talk.

tldr.title: TL;DR
tldr.intro: Your screenshots and audio are stored locally on your PC in %LocalAppData%\Roaster. I send data to AI services (Claude, ElevenLabs) and Discord only when needed to make Axl work. I track anonymous usage stats to improve the app. I don't sell your data.
tldr.point1: Screenshots and audio stay on your PC
tldr.point2: I don't access your screenshots, audio, or Discord messages

dataFlow.title: Where Your Data Goes
dataFlow.intro: To make Axl work, I send your data to these AI services. Here's what gets sent to each one:

anthropic.title: ðŸ’¡ Anthropic (Claude AI)
anthropic.whatSend: What I send: Your gameplay screenshots, conversation history (what Axl said before), and the companion's personality prompt.
anthropic.why: Why: So Claude can analyze what's happening in your game and generate relevant commentary.
anthropic.whatDontSend: What I DON'T send: Your Discord messages, voice chat audio, or any personal info.
anthropic.policy: Check their privacy policy at anthropic.com/privacy

elevenlabs.title: ðŸ”Š ElevenLabs (Text-to-Speech)
elevenlabs.whatSend: What I send: Only the text of Axl's commentary (what Claude generated).
elevenlabs.why: Why: To convert the text into Axl's voice.
elevenlabs.whatDontSend: What I DON'T send: Your screenshots, game info, or anything else. Just the commentary text.
elevenlabs.policy: Check their privacy policy at elevenlabs.io/privacy

discord.title: ðŸ’¬ Discord (Voice Playback)
discord.whatGoesThrough: What goes through: Only the audio file of Axl's voice.
discord.why: Why: To play it in your Discord voice channel.
discord.note: Note: Axl uses your Discord server - she doesn't read messages or access any Discord data.
discord.policy: Check their privacy policy at discord.com/privacy

collection.title: What I Actually Collect
collection.intro: I use Google Analytics to understand how people use Axl. This helps me fix bugs and know which features to build next.

optional.title: Optional (you can disable this):
optional.item1: Feature usage (screenshots captured, voice commands used, etc.)
optional.item2: Which settings you change (but not the actual values!)
optional.item3: Crashes and errors (stack traces are hashed for privacy)

dontTrack.title: What I DON'T track:
dontTrack.item1: Your screenshots or what games you play
dontTrack.item2: Your API keys or any credentials
dontTrack.item3: Your Discord server info or messages

collection.randomId: Each installation gets a random ID so I can count users without knowing who you are. It's like a "User #12345" situation.

whyNeed.title: Why I Need This
whyNeed.intro: As a solo dev, analytics help me make Axl better without bothering you with surveys. I can see:
whyNeed.item1: Is anyone actually using this? (nothing's sadder than building features nobody uses)
whyNeed.item2: Which features are popular? (so I can make them even better)
whyNeed.item3: What's breaking? (crashes and errors I need to fix)
whyNeed.item4: How's performance? (if API calls are taking forever, I need to know)

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.intro: You're in control. Here's what you can do:

deleteLocal.title: Delete your local data:
deleteLocal.text: Just uninstall Axl and delete the %LocalAppData%\Roaster folder. That's it. All your local settings and data are gone.

analyticsId.title: Your Analytics ID:
analyticsId.text: Each installation gets a unique ID for anonymous analytics. You can find yours in the app settings.
analyticsId.note: Note: Google Analytics doesn't offer a self-service data deletion API. If you want your analytics data deleted, email me with your ID and I'll manually remove it from GA4.

questions.title: Questions?
questions.text: Open an issue on GitHub (github.com/rblaurent/axl) or DM me.

meta.title: How to Use Axl - Axl
meta.description: Learn how to set up and use Axl, your AI gaming companion for Discord.

header.title: How to Use Axl
header.intro: So you want to get Axl roasting (or hyping) your gameplay? Great choice! Let's get you set up. Don't worry, it's easier than it looks.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.intro: First things first - let's get Axl on your computer.
gettingStarted.step1: Download the installer from the homepage or GitHub releases
gettingStarted.step2: Run AxlSetup.exe (Windows might show a SmartScreen warning - just click "More info" then "Run anyway")
gettingStarted.step3: Launch Axl from your desktop and let's get through the setup wizard together
gettingStarted.autoUpdate: Pro tip: Once installed, Axl auto-updates itself. You'll never have to manually download updates!

setup.title: First Time Setup
setup.intro: When you launch Axl for the first time, you'll go through a setup wizard. Here's what you need to get ready:

claude.title: 1. Claude API Key
claude.intro: Axl uses Claude AI to understand your gameplay. Head to Anthropic Console and:
claude.step2: Go to API Keys and create a new key
claude.step3: Copy and paste it into Axl
claude.cost: Cost: About $0.09 per hour of gameplay. You get $5 free credit when you sign up!

elevenlabs.title: 2. ElevenLabs Voice
elevenlabs.intro: This is what makes Axl sound like an actual person. Go to ElevenLabs and:
elevenlabs.step1: Sign up (they have a free tier!)
elevenlabs.step2: Go to Profile Settings and copy your API key
elevenlabs.step3: Browse the Voice Library, pick a voice you like, and copy the Voice ID
elevenlabs.cost: Cost: About $0.06 per hour, or use the free tier (10,000 characters/month = 3-5 hours of gaming)

discord.title: 3. Discord Setup
discord.intro: This is the trickiest part, but you got this! We need to create a Discord bot and get some IDs.
discord.bot1: Go to Discord Developer Portal
discord.bot2: Click "New Application" and give it a name
discord.bot3: Go to the Bot section and click "Add Bot"
discord.bot4: Copy the bot token (this goes into Axl)
discord.inviteTitle: Invite the bot to your server:
discord.invite1: Go to OAuth2 â†’ URL Generator
discord.invite4: Copy the generated URL and open it in your browser to invite the bot
discord.idsTitle: Get your Server and Channel IDs:
discord.ids1: In Discord, go to Settings â†’ Advanced and enable "Developer Mode"
discord.ids2: Right-click your server name and select "Copy Server ID"
discord.ids3: Right-click your voice channel and select "Copy Channel ID"

personality.title: 4. Pick Axl's Personality
personality.intro: This is the fun part! Choose how Axl talks to you:
personality.roaster: Sarcastic roaster - Classic gaming trash talk and friendly mockery
personality.hype: Wholesome hype person - All positive vibes and encouragement
personality.custom: Custom - Write your own personality description

hotkey.title: 5. Set Your Hotkey
hotkey.intro: Pick a key for instant screenshots when something amazing (or terrible) happens. Default is F8, but you can change it to whatever you like.

using.title: Using Axl
using.intro: Alright, you're all set up! Here's how to actually use Axl:
using.step2: Join your Discord voice channel (Axl will connect automatically)
using.step3: Start gaming - Axl will capture your screen every minute and comment when something interesting happens
using.step4: Hit your hotkey (default F8) when something epic happens for instant commentary
using.step5: Check the Console tab in Axl to see what she's thinking
using.tip1: Make sure you're in the voice channel before starting Axl
using.tip2: Windowed or borderless windowed mode works best for screen captures
using.tip3: Choose a personality that matches your vibe and gaming style
using.tip4: Axl decides when to comment - she won't spam during boring moments
using.tip5: The more context she has, the better her commentary gets

customization.title: Customization
customization.intro: Want to fine-tune Axl's behavior? You can change almost everything:

personality.title: Personality Tab
personality.intro: Change Axl's personality anytime without restarting. Switch between presets or write your own custom personality description.

settings.title: Settings Tab
settings.interval: Capture interval - How often to auto-capture (default: 60 seconds)
settings.hotkey: Hotkey - Change the instant capture key
settings.context: Context size - How much conversation history Axl remembers

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.intro: Running into issues? Here are the most common problems and fixes:

voice.title: Axl won't join voice channel
voice.fix1: Make sure the bot is invited to your server
voice.fix2: Double-check your Server ID and Channel ID are correct
voice.fix3: Verify the bot has "Connect" and "Speak" permissions

audio.title: No audio playing
audio.fix1: Join the voice channel yourself first, then start Axl
audio.fix2: Check that Axl shows as connected in the UI
audio.fix3: Look for errors in the Console tab

screenshots.title: Screenshots failing
screenshots.fix3: Make sure antivirus isn't blocking screen capture

api.title: "API Key Invalid" errors
api.fix1: Double-check you copied the full key with no extra spaces
api.fix2: Verify you have credits remaining in your API account
api.fix3: For Discord token issues, try regenerating it

cost.title: What Does It Cost?
cost.intro: Let's be real - AI services cost money. But it's pretty reasonable!
cost.typical: Typical 1-hour gaming session: About $0.15 total (Claude: $0.09 + ElevenLabs: $0.06)
cost.freeTitle: Free tiers to get you started:
cost.free1: â€¢ Anthropic: $5 free credit when you sign up
cost.free2: â€¢ ElevenLabs: 10,000 characters/month free (covers 3-5 hours of gaming)
cost.conclusion: So you can try Axl for free, and if you love it, the costs are about the same as a fancy coffee per 6-7 hours of gaming!

ready.title: Ready to Roll!
ready.paragraph1: That's it! You're all set to have Axl roasting (or hyping) your gameplay. Remember, she's meant to be fun - don't take her too seriously!
ready.paragraph2: If you run into any issues not covered here, check out the Console tab in Axl for error messages, or feel free to reach out for help.
ready.paragraph3: Now go game, and let Axl bring the commentary. Have fun out there!
